title: Standard basis
summary: In mathematics, the standard basis (also called natural basis or canonical basis) of a coordinate vector space (such as R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} or C n {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{n}} ) is the set of vectors whose components are all zero, except one that equals 1.
